lead_paragraph: An N.F.L. executive’s acknowledgment of a link between football and degenerative brain disorders could have ripple effects throughout the sport.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and ALAN SCHWARZ

headline.print_headline: Game May Never Be the Same as N.F.L. Shifts on Concussions
headline.main: N.F.L. Shifts on Concussions, and Game May Never Be the Same

snippet: An N.F.L. executive’s acknowledgment of a link between football and degenerative brain disorders could have ripple effects throughout the sport.
abstract: Admission by NFL health official Jeff Miller that football is linked to  degenerative brain disease known as chronic traumatic encephalopathy stands to profoundly affect most popular sport in America;  league's admission, made before federal officials, will likely affect college, high school and youth football and outcome of present and future lawsuits.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
